header.title: CosTimerEvent_TimerEventHandler

erlref.modulesummary: This module implements the OMG CosTimerEvent::TimerEventHandler interface.

description.p:
To get access to the record definitions for the structures use:
-include_lib("cosTime/include/*.hrl").

func.name: '_get_status'(TimerEventHandler) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Return the status of the target object

desc.p: This operation returns the status of the target object.

list.item: 'ESTimeSet' - timer is set to trigger event(s).
'ESTimeCleared' - no time set or the timer have been reset.
'ESFailedTrigger' - tried to, but failed, sending the event.

desc.p: If the target object is of type 'TTPeriodic' the status value 'ESTriggered' is not valid.

func.name: time_set(TimerEventHandler) -> Reply
func.fsummary: Return trueif the time has been set for an event that is yet to be triggered, falseotherwise. The outparameter represents the current time value of the target object

desc.p: This operation returns true if the time has been set for an event that is yet to be triggered, false otherwise. The outparameter represents the current time value of the target object.

func.name: set_timer(TimerEventHandler, TimeType, TriggerTime) -> void()
func.fsummary: Terminate terminate any previous set trigger, and set a new trigger specified by the TimeTypeand UTOobjects

desc.p: This operation terminates any previous set trigger, and set a new trigger specified by the TimeType and UTO objects.
The relation between the UTO object and the TimeTypes are:

list.item: 'TTAbsolute' - the UTO object must represent absolute time, i.e., number of 100 nanoseconds passed since 15 october 1582 00:00.
'TTRelative' - the UTO object must represent the from now until when the event should be triggered, e.g., within 30*10^7 nanoseconds.
'TTPeriodic' - the same as for 'TTRelative', but this option will trigger an event periodically until timer cancelled.

func.name: cancel_timer(TimerEventHandler) -> boolean()
func.fsummary: Cancel, if possible, triggering of event(s). Returntrueif an event is actually cancelled, falseotherwise

desc.p: This operation cancel, if possible, the triggering of event(s). Returns true if an event is actually cancelled, false otherwise.

func.name: set_data(TimerEventHandler, EventData) -> ok
func.fsummary: Change the event data sent when triggered

desc.p: This operation changes the event data sent when triggered.
